Job Title: Device Interoperability Test Engineer I

Location: Littleton, CO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Company Summary

DISH, an EchoStar Company, has been reimagining the future of connectivity for more than 40 years. Our business reach spans satellite television service, live-streaming and on-demand programming, smart home installation services, mobile plans and products, and now we are building America’s First Smart Network™.

Today, our brands include EchoStar, Hughes, DISH TV, Sling TV, Boost Infinite, Boost Mobile, DISH Wireless, OnTech and GenMobile.

Department Summary

Our Wireless Technology organization is transforming the future of connectivity. We’re doing it by building the country’s first virtualized, standalone 5G wireless network from scratch. The foundation of a connected world, it’s a network free of the limitations of the past, and flexible enough to satisfy all the social, economic and transformative needs of the changing world.

Job Duties And Responsibilities

DISH Wireless is looking for a proactive and innovative individual to enhance the Android/iOS/Linux Device Certification process by providing valuable insights into 4G/5G protocol, testing methodologies, product architecture, and certification requirements. As a member of the Device Engineering department, you will collaborate with Network Engineering, OEMs, third-party vendors, and product managers to introduce 5G devices and address customer issues within an agile framework.

In This Role, You Will

Execute defined/applicable sanity test cases for new and regression software loads across the entire device portfolio.Support OEM Technical Lead with new technology trial execution, as required.Offer input into technical approval publication sent to OEM for each new software release.Conduct testing in both lab and field environments to assist with device certification.Collaborate with the team to collect and analyze device logs to identify and resolve issues.Assist development teams in bringing up 5G networks in new markets through testing and validation.Validate existing and new test tools, frameworks, and methodologies to ensure high-quality solutions for device certification and lifecycle management.

Skills, Experience And Requirements

As a successful Device Interoperability Test Engineer I, you will have:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical, Computer, Telecommunications Engineering, or related field.Minimum of 1 year of experience in the wireless telecom industry, working with service providers or device OEMs.1+ years of experience in technical roles such as engineer/architect, R&D systems, or product management.Proficient in device requirements, test plans, and end-to-end solutions for 4G/5G architecture.Familiarity with 4G/5G device services and associated chipset and core networking technologies.Technical expertise in areas like L2/L3 protocols, Carrier Aggregation, E2E Call Flows, and IMS/VoWiFi.Experience with testing mobile devices, modules, routers, and bug tracking systems like Jira.

Salary Ranges

Compensation: $72,400.00/Year - $108,900.00/Year

Benefits

We also offer versatile health perks, including flexible spending accounts, HSA, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, career opportunities, and a flexible time away plan; all benefits can be viewed here: DISH Benefits.  

The base pay range shown is a guideline. Individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, and competencies; compensation is based on the role's location and is subject to change based on work location. Candidates need to successfully complete a pre-employment screen, which may include a drug test and DMV check.

This will be posted for a minimum of 3 days or until the position is filled.

Experience Level (if available): None
